poem:
"Transmutations of Sound"

Discourse of disheveled rhythms, burgeoning 
In morning's unripened hours. Strident yet tenuous,
The birthed notes of Gallic progeny, Augé and Rosnay.
The drum's call, the guitar's response, musical discourse
Evolving, reverberating, echoing in dancehall chambers.
Dissatisfied with fixed forms, veering away,
Into the labyrinth of the complex.
In sound, an unmoored ship set toward uncertainty,
Though shorn in harsh light, still casting a vital shadow.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Justice: Hyperdrama review – an uncertain return to the dancefloor With their self-titled 2007 debut, French production duo Justice – Gaspard Augé and Xavier de Rosnay – established themselves as promising Daft Punk successors. Combining arena-sized drum tracks with squealing guitars and a thundering dancefloor pulse, they delivered gargantuan melodic hooks with gut-thumping force. Yet subsequent releases have struggled to elicit the same sense of vitality. Audio, Video, Disco, from 2011, veered into the complicated". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.

Yet subsequent releases have struggled to elicit the same sense of vitality. Audio, Video, Disco, from 2011, veered into the complicated
